div.l: So full of hoker and of bismare
Here thowth þat a lady scholde here spare
What for hire kynrede and here nortelrie
That sche hadde lerned in the Nonnerie
A doughter had þei between hem twoo
Of xxᵗⁱ yeer olde wᵗithout any moo
Sauyng a Childe þᵗat was of half yeer age
In Cradil it lay / it was a propre page
This wenche þikke ⁊and wel growen was
Wᵗith Camuse nose ⁊and eyen greye as glas
Wᵗith buttokys brode ⁊and brestis rounde ⁊and hie
Right fayr was here heer y wol not lie
The p̉erson of þe Toun̄ for sche was faire
In purpose was to make her his ayre
Boþe of his catel and of his mesuage
And straunge he made it of here mariage
¶ Grete soken had þis myller out of doute
Of whete of malte / and of þe londe aboute
And namly ther was a grete college
Men cleped þe scoler halle of Cambregge
Þer was here whete ⁊and eke her malt grounde
And on a day it happed on a stounde
Sike lay þe manciple on a maladie
Men wende wisly þat he sholde die
For which þis Miller stale boþe mele ⁊and corn̄
An hundred tyme more than beforn̄
For þer befor he stale but curtesly
But now he was a thefe outrageously
For which þe wardeyn chidde ⁊and made fare
But þer of sette þe myller not a tare
He craked bosted and swore it was not soo
Then were ther Power scolers twoo
Þat dwelled in þe hall of which y seide
Testif þei were and lustily they pleyde
And oonly for here myrthe and Revelrye
Vpon þe wardeyn besily they crye
To yeve hem leve but a litle stounde
To go to mylle / ⁊and se here corne grounde
And hardily þei durst ley · here necke
Þe myller scholde not stele half a pecke
Of Corn̄ / bi sleight / ne bi force hem reve
And att þe laste þe Wardeyn yafe hem leve
Iohn hight þat oon / and aleyn hight þat oþer
And in oo toun̄ were þei born þat men call Stroder
Ferre in þe North y can not telle where
This aleyn makith redy all his gere
And on a hors þe sak þei caste anon̄
Forth goon aleyn þe Clerk ⁊and also Iohn
Wᵗith good swerdes and bokelers be here side
Iohn knew þe way hem neded noo gyde
And att þe laste / þe sak doun̄ he leyth
Aleyn spake furst all heyll Symond in feyth
Howe fares þi faire doughter ⁊and þi wife
Aleyn̄ wel come // qduod Symkyn be my life
